Name: flat glass production, coated | flat glass, coated | EN15804GD, U
Category: C:Manufacturing/23:Manufacture of other non-metallic mineral products/231:Manufacture of glass and glass products/2310:Manufacture of glass and glass products
Description: Metal coating (mainly Bismuth, Silver and Nickel-Chrome) are applied on float glass by cathodic sputtering in vacuum. The installation is fed in batch quantities. At ambient pressure the vessel is charged and then vacuum is generated. The sputtering process works by passing an electrical current through ionised gas, thus bombarding the surface of a metal cathode with ions. The atoms of the desired metal are vaporised and then deposited in a thin film on the surface of glass
